software_engineer.name: Software Engineer Track
software_engineer.description: Technical individual contributor path for software development

levels.title: Junior Software Engineer
levels.summary: Entry-level position requiring close guidance and support

levels.title: Senior Software Engineer
levels.summary: Independent contributor working on clearly defined tasks

levels.title: Lead Software Engineer
levels.summary: Technical leader introducing new technologies and architectures

levels.title: Principal Software Engineer
levels.summary: Senior technical leader with organizational impact
levels.impact_scope: Organization-wide technical strategy and complex problem solving

levels.title: Software Architect
levels.summary: Responsible for architecture of projects with significant impact

levels.title: Senior Software Architect
levels.summary: Responsible for architecture of large-scale, high-impact projects

PC06.title: Junior Software Engineer
PC06.expectations: Assistance in expanding, implementing and documenting software components and systems within established processes.

PC07.title: Software Engineer
PC07.expectations: Assistance in expanding, implementing and documenting software components and systems within established processes.

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Independently expand, implement and document software components and systems according to clearly defined tasks (e.g. processing of planned tasks from the backlog).

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Independently design, expand, implement, and document software components and systems. Collaborate on the introduction of new technologies or architectures (e.g. changeover of components including active participation in the planning of tasks for this).

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Independently design, expand, implement, and document software components and systems. Recognize and understand the causes of complex problems, assess their effects and design suitable solutions for their own area of responsibility (e.g. by introducing new technologies or architectures).

PC06.title: Junior Software Engineer
PC06.expectations: Development according to central development processes and team development and operating processes with the close guidance and support of a specialist.

PC07.title: Software Engineer
PC07.expectations: Development according to central development processes and team development and operating processes with the support of a specialist.

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Development according to central development processes and team development and operational processes. Assist in improving team internal development and operational processes.

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Design and coordinate the team's internal development process. Support in the improvement of central development and operational processes (e.g. QM).

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Design and coordinate the team's internal development process. Support in the improvement of central development and operational processes (e.g. QM).

PC06.title: Junior Software Engineer
PC06.expectations: Familiarize to ongoing quality control within the scope of existing concepts.

PC07.title: Software Engineer
PC07.expectations: Contribute to ongoing quality control within the scope of existing concepts.

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Responsibility for the ongoing quality control within the scope of existing concepts.

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Responsibility for the ongoing quality control and involvement in the introduction of new quality control concepts.

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Responsibility for the ongoing quality control. Development and implementation of quality control concepts.

PC06.title: Junior Software Engineer
PC06.expectations: Assist with error analysis throughout the development process and developing proposed solutions.

PC07.title: Software Engineer
PC07.expectations: Assist with error analysis throughout the development process and independently develop and implement solutions. Evaluate the effects on a subsystem.

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Independent error analysis throughout the development process as well as independent development and implementation of solution approaches. Evaluation of the effects on the internal system.

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Independent error analysis throughout the entire development process as well as independent development and implementation of solution approaches and evaluation of the effects on the environment.

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Independent error analysis throughout the entire development process as well as independent development and implementation of solution approaches and evaluation of the effects on the environment.

PC06.title: Junior Software Engineer
PC06.expectations: Familiarize with already used technologies within their field of work.

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Familiarize with new technologies and their use in software components and systems under supervision.

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Collaborate in the implementation of new technologies in software components and systems.

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Identify trends, assess their significance for their own area of responsibility, and implement them.

operations.name: Operations & SRE
operations.description: System reliability, security, availability, and scalability

PC06.title: Junior Software Engineer
PC06.expectations: Familiarize with working on monitoring and assuring guaranteed system or service characteristics according to associated concepts (e.g., security, availability, and scalability).

PC07.title: Software Engineer
PC07.expectations: Preliminary work to monitor and assure guaranteed system or service characteristics according to associated concepts (e.g., security, availability, and scalability).

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Contribute to monitoring and assurance of guaranteed system or service characteristics in accordance with associated concepts (e.g., security, availability, and scalability).

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Monitor and assure guaranteed system or service characteristics and participate in the creation of associated concepts (e.g., security, availability, and scalability).

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Monitor and assure guaranteed system or service characteristics and create associated concepts (e.g., security, availability, and scalability).

architecture.name: Architecture & System Design
architecture.description: System architecture and technical concept development

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Detail technical concepts for individual components within the framework of a given system architecture.

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Contribute in the creation and implementation of technical concepts for systems and components.

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Develop and implement technical concepts for systems and components, assess the impact on the environment and coordinate with other agencies as necessary.

PC06.title: Junior Software Engineer
PC06.expectations: Familiarize on the maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Delivery infrastructure (e.g. build server, ...).

PC07.title: Software Engineer
PC07.expectations: Collaborate on the maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Delivery infrastructure (e.g. build server, ...).

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Maintenance of Continuous Integration and Delivery infrastructure (e.g. build server, ...).

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Maintain and assist in building and improving continuous integration and delivery infrastructure (e.g. build server, ...).

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Plan and select continuous integration and delivery infrastructure (e.g. build server) according to technical and commercial aspects. Build and improve it.

PC06.title: Junior Software Engineer
PC06.expectations: Attend in knowledge exchange formats, both within their own team and the department.

PC07.title: Software Engineer
PC07.expectations: Actively participate in knowledge exchange formats, both within their own team and the department.

PC08.title: Senior Software Engineer
PC08.expectations: Actively sharing work results and acquired expertise, for example, from conferences and trainings.

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Actively sharing work results and acquired expertise, for example, from conferences and trainings. Orientation of new colleagues.

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Actively sharing existing technical expertise. Guidance from colleagues (e.g. professional, technical or personal mentoring).

communication.name: Technical Communication
communication.description: Communicating technical decisions and representing the team

PC09.title: Lead Software Engineer
PC09.expectations: Provide comprehensive advice on technical issues within the team. Occasionally represent the technical perspective on behalf of the team in decision making sessions.

PC10.title: Principal Software Engineer
PC10.expectations: Provide comprehensive advice on technical issues, including across projects and divisions. Routinely represent the technical perspective on behalf of the team in decision making sessions.

architect.expectations: Collection and documentation as well as technical evaluation of functional and non-functional requirements.

senior_architect.expectations: Collection and documentation as well as technical evaluation of functional and non-functional requirements across several teams.

architect.expectations: Development of architecture concepts. Ensuring technical feasibility and successful implementations, managing technical risks and taking business aspects as well as applicable regulations and standards into account.

senior_architect.expectations: Development of architecture concepts. Ensuring technical feasibility and successful implementations, managing technical risks and taking business aspects as well as applicable regulations and standards into account. Consideration of team structures - enabling parallel (scaling) processing of development tasks derived from the architecture specification. Consideration of the available skills and experience of the development team when planning technology and architecture specifications.

stakeholder_management.name: Stakeholder Management
stakeholder_management.description: Managing relationships and communicating with stakeholders

architect.expectations: Responsible for concepts and design of solutions towards stakeholders. Communicates in a manner that is appropriate to the target audience and at the correct technical level of abstraction. Collaborates with Project Managers and Product Owners to create work packages and effort estimates.

senior_architect.expectations: Responsible for concepts and design of solutions towards stakeholders. Active stakeholder management and planning of required technical refactorings in the overall system. Communicates in a target group oriented manner and at the right technical level. Collaborates with Project Managers and Product Owners to create work packages and effort estimates.

architect.expectations: Responsible for the architecture of a project or product that falls under Bosch.IO Project Impact Category D. This is also applicable to products.

senior_architect.expectations: Responsible for the architecture of a project or product that falls under Bosch.IO Project Impact Category C. This is also applicable to products.

architect.expectations: Knowing technology trends, assessing their importance to their own team, and incorporating them into their own solutions.

senior_architect.expectations: Knowing and recognizing technology trends, on the market and within the Bosch Group, assessing their significance for one's own team and incorporating them into their own solutions.

shared.expectations: Advise development team on planning, organization and feasibility of requirements, concepts and designs. Responsible for planning the fixing of technical debt into the development process. Responsible for creating and ensuring a testing strategy is in place.

presales.name: Pre-Sales Activities
presales.description: Technical support for sales and business development

architect.expectations: Preparation and implementation of pre-sales activities (e.g. preparation PoC, presentations, technical parts of the offer, cost estimation).

senior_architect.expectations: Preparation and implementation of pre-sales activities (e.g. preparation PoC, presentations, technical parts of the offer, cost estimation). Feed back insights from pre-sales discussions to create proposals for strategic and technical direction.

knowledge_exchange_architect.name: Knowledge Exchange (Architect)
knowledge_exchange_architect.description: Shaping and sharing technology landscape knowledge

architect.expectations: Helping to shape the technology landscape in their own area.

senior_architect.expectations: Design, implement and facilitate knowledge sharing both within the team and with stakeholders and at the interface with other teams. Define the technology landscape beyond the domain.

shared.expectations: Responsible for ensuring documentation is up to date. Common architecture documentation standards are applied and architecture decisions are documented traceable to requirements.

proficiency_mapping.description: Mapping between proficiency levels in different systems

standard_levels.description: Learning and developing fundamental skills with guidance
